meanings.definition: The unit of force in the centimeter-gram-second system, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one centimeter per second per second on a mass of one gram.
meanings.sent1: She measured the force in dyne using a special scale.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use dyne to calculate small forces accurately.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant pushed with a dyne of strength to move the sugar cube.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a dyne that propelled him forward against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The dyne of his punch was so powerful, it knocked the wind out of his opponent.

meanings.definition: A unit of force, especially in the centimeter-gram-second system, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one centimeter per second per second on a mass of one gram.
meanings.sent1: The machine measured the force in dyne accurately.
meanings.sent2: In physics, dyne is a crucial unit for small force calculations.
meanings.sent3: The cat pounced on the toy with the force of a single dyne.
meanings.sent4: Her words carried a dyne of emotion that touched everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dyne of his voice resonated through the auditorium, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A unit of force in the centimeter-gram-second system, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one centimeter per second per second on a mass of one gram.
meanings.sent1: The textbook explained the concept of dyne clearly.
meanings.sent2: Dyne is commonly used in physics experiments for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gathered nuts with a dyne of determination.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a dyne that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The dyne of his presence was felt by everyone as soon as he entered the room.
